<L>129743.1<pc>652,2<k1>pyAy<k2>pyAy<e>1

<div n="to"/>to swell, be exuberant, overflow:
<div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> <s>pyAya/yati</s>, <s>°te</s>, <ls>AV.</ls> &c.;
<div n="to"/> (<ab>Pass.</ab> <s>pyAyya/te</s>, <ls>Br.</ls>) to make overflow, fill up (mostly in <ab>comp.</ab> with <s>A-</s> See <s>A-pyE</s>; <ab>cf.</ab> √ <s>pi</s>, <s>pI</s>).

<div n="P"/> mode, manner, way, <ls>Vcar.</ls>;
<div n="P"/> way of dressing, fashion, toilet, <ls>Bālar.</ls>; <ls>Rājat.</ls>;
<div n="P"/> (<ab>ifc.</ab>) mere appearance or semblance of <ls>Kathās.</ls>; <ls>Rājat.</ls>;
<div n="P"/> fraud, deception, <ls>L.</ls>;
<div n="P"/> irony, wit, repartee, <ls>W.</ls>;
<div n="P"/> modesty, <ls>MW.</ls>;
<div n="P"/> = <s>BaNga</s> (with <s1 slp1="jEna">Jaina</s1>s), <ls>Sarvad.</ls>;
<div n="P"/> figure, shape, <ls>Siddhāntaś.</ls>;
<div n="P"/> a step (see <s>Bakti</s>);
<div n="P"/> a wave, <ls>Naiṣ.</ls>

<s>meTuH</s>, <s>meTire</s>, <ls>Br.</ls>;
<s>mamanTa</s>, <s>°nTuH</s>, <ls>MBh.</ls>;

<s>°tos</s>, <ls>Br.</ls>;

<s>manTitvA</s>, <ls>Pāṇ. i, 2, 33</ls>;
<s>-manTya</s> and <s>-mATam</s>, <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.),
<div n="to"/>to stir or whirl round, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.;
<div n="to"/> (with <s>agnim</s>), to produce fire by rapidly whirling round or rotating a dry stick (<s>araRi</s>) in another dry stick prepared to receive it, <ls>ib.</ls>;
<div n="to"/> (with <s>araRim</s>), to rotate the stick for producing fire, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>Pur.</ls>;
<div n="to"/> (with <s>Urum</s>, <s>hastam</s> &c.), to use friction upon any part of the body with the object of producing offspring from it, <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls>;
<div n="to"/>to churn (milk into butter), produce by churning, <ls>TS.</ls> &c. &c. (also with two <ab>acc.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> <s>suDAM kzIra-niDim maTnAti</s>, ‘he churns nectar out of the ocean of milk’, <ls>Siddh.</ls> on <ls>Pāṇ. i, 4, 51</ls>);
<div n="to"/>to mix, mingle, <ls>Suśr.</ls>;
<div n="to"/>to stir up, shake, agitate, trouble disturb, afflict, distress, hurt, destroy, <ls>AV.</ls> &c. &c.:
<div n="vp"/><ab>Pass.</ab> <s>maTya/te</s> (<lang>ep.</lang> also <s>°ti</s>), to be stirred up or churned &c., <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.:

<s>raYj</s> or <s>raj</s> ¦ <ab>cl.</ab> 1. 4. <ab>Ā.</ab> <ab>P.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xxiii, 30</ls>; <ls n="Dhātup.">xxvi, 58</ls>) <s>rajati</s>, <s>°te</s> (only <ab>Gr.</ab>; <s>-raYjati</s>, <ls>R. vii, 99, 11</ls>) or <s>rajyati</s>, <s>°te</s> (<ab>Gr.</ab> also <ab>pf.</ab> <ab>P.</ab> <s>raraYja</s>, 3rd <ab>du.</ab> <s>rarajatuH</s> or <s>raraYjatuH</s>; <ab>Ā.</ab> <s>raraYje</s>; <ab>aor.</ab> <s>arANkzIt</s>, <s>araNkta</s>; <ab>Prec.</ab> <s>rajyAt</s>, <s>raNkzIzwa</s>; <ab>fut.</ab> <s>raNktA</s>; <s>raNkzyati</s>, <s>°te</s>; <ab>inf.</ab> <s>raNktum</s>; <ab>ind.p.</ab> <s>raktvA</s> or <s>raNktvA</s>), <info or="173342,raYj;173342.1,raj"/><info westergaard="ranja,23.30,01.0721;ranja,26.58,04.0061"/><info whitneyroots="raj2,134"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="1,4P,4Ā"/>
<div n="to"/>to be dyed or coloured, to redden, grow red, glow, <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls>;
<div n="to"/>to be affected or moved, be excited or glad, be charmed or delighted by (<ab>instr.</ab>), be attracted by or enamoured of, fall in love with (<ab>loc.</ab>), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.;
<div n="to"/> (<s>rajati</s>, <s>°te</s>), to go, <ls>Naigh. ii, 14</ls> :
<div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> <s>rajayati</s> (only <ls>AV.</ls>) and <s>raYjayati</s>, <s>°te</s> (<ab>aor.</ab> <s>arIrajat</s> or <s>araraYjat</s>; <ab>Pass.</ab> <s>rajyate</s>; <ab>aor.</ab> <s>araYji</s> or <s>arAYji</s>),
<div n="to"/>to dye, colour, paint, redden, illuminate, <ls>AV.</ls> &c. &c.;
<div n="to"/>to rejoice, charm, gratify, conciliate, <ls>MaitrUp.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.;
<div n="to"/>to worship, <ls>Naigh. iii, 14</ls> (<s>rajayati mfgAn</s> = <s>ramayati mfgAn</s>, <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 4, 24</ls>, <ab>Vārtt.</ab> 3, <ls>Pat.</ls>) :
<div n="vp"/><ab>Desid.</ab> <s>riraNkzati</s>, <s>°te</s> <ab>Gr.</ab>:
<div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> <s>rArajIti</s> (<ab>Gr.</ab> also <s>rArajyate</s> and <s>rAraNkti</s>), to be greatly excited, exult, <ls>RV. ix, 5, 2</ls> (others ‘to shine bright’). [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>ῥέζω</gk>, ‘to dye’, <gk>ῥεγεύς</gk>, ‘dyer’.]
<LEND>

<L>173342.1<pc>861,2<k1>raj<k2>raj<e>1
<s>raYj</s> or <s>raj</s> ¦ <ab>cl.</ab> 1. 4. <ab>Ā.</ab> <ab>P.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xxiii, 30</ls>; <ls n="Dhātup.">xxvi, 58</ls>) <s>rajati</s>, <s>°te</s> (only <ab>Gr.</ab>; <s>-raYjati</s>, <ls>R. vii, 99, 11</ls>) or <s>rajyati</s>, <s>°te</s> (<ab>Gr.</ab> also <ab>pf.</ab> <ab>P.</ab> <s>raraYja</s>, 3rd <ab>du.</ab> <s>rarajatuH</s> or <s>raraYjatuH</s>; <ab>Ā.</ab> <s>raraYje</s>; <ab>aor.</ab> <s>arANkzIt</s>, <s>araNkta</s>; <ab>Prec.</ab> <s>rajyAt</s>, <s>raNkzIzwa</s>; <ab>fut.</ab> <s>raNktA</s>; <s>raNkzyati</s>, <s>°te</s>; <ab>inf.</ab> <s>raNktum</s>; <ab>ind.p.</ab> <s>raktvA</s> or <s>raNktvA</s>), <info or="173342,raYj;173342.1,raj"/><info westergaard="ranja,23.30,01.0721;ranja,26.58,04.0061"/><info whitneyroots="raj2,134"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="1,4P,4Ā"/>

<div n="to"/>to be affected or moved, be excited or glad, be charmed or delighted by (<ab>instr.</ab>), be attracted by or enamoured of, fall in love with (<ab>loc.</ab>), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.;
<div n="to"/> (<s>rajati</s>, <s>°te</s>), to go, <ls>Naigh. ii, 14</ls> :
<div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> <s>rajayati</s> (only <ls>AV.</ls>) and <s>raYjayati</s>, <s>°te</s> (<ab>aor.</ab> <s>arIrajat</s> or <s>araraYjat</s>; <ab>Pass.</ab> <s>rajyate</s>; <ab>aor.</ab> <s>araYji</s> or <s>arAYji</s>),
<div n="to"/>to dye, colour, paint, redden, illuminate, <ls>AV.</ls> &c. &c.;
<div n="to"/>to rejoice, charm, gratify, conciliate, <ls>MaitrUp.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.;
<div n="to"/>to worship, <ls>Naigh. iii, 14</ls> (<s>rajayati mfgAn</s> = <s>ramayati mfgAn</s>, <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 4, 24</ls>, <ab>Vārtt.</ab> 3, <ls>Pat.</ls>) :

<div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> <s>rArajIti</s> (<ab>Gr.</ab> also <s>rArajyate</s> and <s>rAraNkti</s>), to be greatly excited, exult, <ls>RV. ix, 5, 2</ls> (others ‘to shine bright’). [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>ῥέζω</gk>, ‘to dye’, <gk>ῥεγεύς</gk>, ‘dyer’.]

; and/or group 3149: 202863,vistf;202863.1,vistF
; **********************************************
<L>202863<pc>1001,3<k1>vistf<k2>vi-stf<e>1
<s>vi-√ stf</s> (or <s>-stF</s>) ¦ <ab>P.</ab> <ab>Ā.</ab> <s>-stfRoti</s>, <s>-stfRute</s>;<info or="202863,vistf;202863.1,vistF"/><info verb="pre" cp="PĀ" parse="vi+stf"/>
<div n="vp"/> <s>-stfRAti</s>, <s>-stfRIte</s> (<lang>ep.</lang> also <s>-starati</s>; <ab>ind.p.</ab> <s>-stIrya</s>, or <s>-stftya</s>),
<div n="to"/>to spread out, scatter, strew (sacrificial grass), <ls>R.</ls>;
<div n="to"/>to expand, extend (wings), <ls>R.</ls>;
<div n="to"/>to spread abroad, diffuse, divulge, <ls>BhP.</ls>;
<div n="to"/>to enlarge or expatiate upon, speak diffusely about (<ab>acc.</ab>), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> (<s>vi-stIrya</s> <lex type="part">ind.</lex> copiously, at large);
<div n="to"/> (with <s>vacanam</s>) to exchange words, converse with (<ab>instr.</ab>), <ls>ib.</ls> :
<div n="vp"/><ab>Pass.</ab> <s>-stIryate</s> or <s>-staryate</s> (<ab>fut.</ab> <s>-starizyate</s>), to be spread abroad or widely diffused, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls>;
<div n="to"/>to be explained, <ls>Divyāv.</ls> :
<div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> <s>-stArayati</s>, to spread, extend, diffuse, display, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c. (<s>-stArya</s>, fully, copiously, at length);

<div n="vp"/> (with <s>iva</s> or <s>yaTA</s>, ‘to shine or look like’; with <s>na</s>, ‘to look bad, have a bad appearance, appear to disadvantage’), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.;

<div n="to"/>to flash or flit <ab>i.e.</ab> glide rapidly past or along, <ls>RV.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> <s>SuBAna/</s>, <s>SumBa/mAna</s>, and <s>pra-√ SumB</s>);

<ab>Prec.</ab> <s>stfzIya</s>, <ls>AV.</ls>;
<s>staryAt</s> or <s>stIryAt</s>;

<ab>fut.</ab> <s>startA</s> <ab>Gr.</ab>;

<ab>inf.</ab> <s>startum</s> or <s>starItum</s> or <s>staritum</s> <ab>Gr.</ab>;
<s>sta/rtave</s>, <s>°tavE</s>, <s>starItavE/</s> or <s>staritavE/</s>, <ls>Br.</ls>;

<div n="to"/>to spread, spread out or about, strew, scatter (<ab>esp.</ab> the sacrificial grass; in this sense in older language only <ab>cl.</ab> 9. <ab>Ā.</ab> <ab>P.</ab>), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>Br.</ls>; <ls>ŚrS.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>;

; and/or group 3886: 257061,sma;257061.1,smA
; **********************************************
<L>257061<pc>1271,2<k1>sma<k2>sma<e>1
<s>sma</s>, <s>smA</s>, (or <s>zma</s>, <s>zmA</s>), ¦ <lex>ind.</lex> a particle perhaps originally equivalent to ‘ever’, ‘always’<info or="257061,sma;257061.1,smA"/>;<info lex="ind"/>
<div n="P"/> and later to ‘indeed’, ‘certainly’, ‘verily’, ‘surely’ (it is often used pleonastically, and in earlier language generally follows a similar particle [<ab>esp.</ab> <s>ha</s>, <s>na</s>], or relative, or <ab>prep.</ab> or verb, while in later language it frequently follows <s>iti</s>, <s>na</s> and <s>mA/</s> [<ab>cf.</ab> <hom>1.</hom> <s>mA/</s>]; it is also joined with a <ab>pres.</ab> tense or <ab>pres.</ab> participle to give them a past sense [<ab>e.g.</ab> <s>praviSanti sma</s>, ‘they entered’]; this use of <s>sma</s> is also found in the <s1 slp1="brAhmaRa">Brāhmaṇa</s1>s and is extended to <s>veda</s> and <s>Aha</s> <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Vām. v, 2, 46</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls>; &c. &c.
<LEND>
;
<L>257061.1<pc>1271,2<k1>smA<k2>smA<e>1
<s>sma</s>, <s>smA</s>, (or <s>zma</s>, <s>zmA</s>), ¦ <lex>ind.</lex> a particle perhaps originally equivalent to ‘ever’, ‘always’<info or="257061,sma;257061.1,smA"/>;<info lex="ind"/>
<div n="P"/> and later to ‘indeed’, ‘certainly’, ‘verily’, ‘surely’ (it is often used pleonastically, and in earlier language generally follows a similar particle [<ab>esp.</ab> <s>ha</s>, <s>na</s>], or relative, or <ab>prep.</ab> or verb, while in later language it frequently follows <s>iti</s>, <s>na</s> and <s>mA/</s> [<ab>cf.</ab> <hom>1.</hom> <s>mA/</s>]; it is also joined with a <ab>pres.</ab> tense or <ab>pres.</ab> participle to give them a past sense [<ab>e.g.</ab> <s>praviSanti sma</s>, ‘they entered’]; this use of <s>sma</s> is also found in the <s1 slp1="brAhmaRa">Brāhmaṇa</s1>s and is extended to <s>veda</s> and <s>Aha</s> <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Vām. v, 2, 46</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls>; &c. &c.
